required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study in Previously Transplanted Living Donor Kidney Recipients Following FCR001 Cell Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Multi-center, Exploratory Safety and Efficacy Study of FCR001 Cell-based Therapy to Induce Donor-specific Tolerance in Previously Transplanted Recipients of a Kidney From a Living Donor, and Safety in FCR001 Donors

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label study to assess the safety, efficacy, and tolerance of FCR001 cell therapy in adult recipients 3-12 months after kidney transplantation from a living donor.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, preliminary efficacy, and overall benefit of FCR001 cell therapy in previously transplanted recipients of a kidney from a living donor.
FCR001 is a novel, cryopreserved allogeneic somatic cell therapy, derived from mobilized peripheral blood mononuclear cells from the same donor as the allograft, and containing hematopoietic progenitor cells, facilitating cells, and αβ T cells. The rationale is to establish durable chimerism and donor-specific tolerance in the recipient enabling freedom from chronic immunosuppression (IS) and its associated toxicities.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of FCR recipients (FCR-R) who are free from immunosuppression (IS), without biopsy-proven acute rejection (BPAR), at 24 months post-FCR001 infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in renal function (estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate, eGFR) by Modification of Diet in Renal Disease [MDRD4]) from baseline to Month 24 in FCR recipients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 prior to infusion to 24 months

secondary_outcome.description: Renal function (eGFR) to be computed using MDRD4 formula

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in renal allograft function over time by MDRD4
secondary_outcome.description: Change in renal function (eGFR by MDRD4), from post- transplant baseline (Day 1, prior to infusion) to Month 24 in FCR recipients. An average eGFR will be calculated and used for the Month 24 eGFR

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal allograft function (eGFR) by Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) formula
Change in renal allograft function over time by CKD-EPI
secondary_outcome.description: Change in renal allograft function from Day 1 to Months 24 and 60; eGFR to be calculated using CKD-EPI formula

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to event for the composite of BPAR (Grade ≥1A), graft loss, death, or lost to follow-up and each component
Incidence of composite endpoint of BPAR, graft loss, or death
Incidence of adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs), and AEs leading to study and/or regimen discontinuation
Incidence of BK viremia, viruria, infection, and nephropathy
Incidence of donor chimerism by visit
Incidence of recipient autologous apheresis product infusion
Graft survival for recipients transiently chimeric
secondary_outcome.description: Graft loss is used to determine graft survival. Graft loss is defined as 56 consecutive days of hemodialysis or re-transplantation

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of composite endpoint of BPAR, death, renal graft loss, and lost to follow-up in FCR-R who did not achieve durable chimerism or able to wean or remain off IS

arm_group.description: Recipients 3-12 months post-living kidney transplantation undergo non-myeloablative conditioning followed by infusion of an enriched hematopoietic stem cell product derived from the same living donor's peripheral blood stem cells

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Recipient age ≥18 years old.
2. Donor age ≥18 and ≤60 years old.
3. Recipient of a first kidney transplant from a living unrelated or non-HLA identical living related donor 3-12 months prior to signing informed consent.
4. Stable renal allograft function ≥60 mL/min/1.73m^2 prior to screening (defined as <25% decrease in eGFR (by Modification of Diet in Renal Disease formula [MDRD4]) between the last 2 consecutive visits and per investigator judgment).
5. Donor willing to undergo mobilization, apheresis, and 12-month safety follow-up.
6. Both donor and recipient must meet the institution's criteria for stem cell transplantation.
Exclusion Criteria (Recipient and Donor):
1. Donor/recipient crossmatch positive at Screening.
2. Recipient and donor who are identical twins.
3. Pregnant or nursing (lactating) woman.
Exclusion Criteria (Recipient):
4. Multi-organ or cell transplant recipient.
5. Blood type ABO incompatible versus donor.
6. Positive donor specific antibody (DSA) at any time prior to FCR001 infusion
7. PRA >20% historical or present at any time prior to FCR001 infusion.
8. Induction with alemtuzumab at the time of living donor kidney transplantation.
9. History of acute rejection (biopsy-proven or suspected and treated) or recurrent kidney disease following living donor kidney transplantation.
10. Findings consistent with acute rejection or recurrent disease on the Screening biopsy.
11. Received transfused blood products since living donor kidney transplantation.
12. Demonstrated intolerance to maintenance immunosuppression with tacrolimus and MMF or MPS.
13. Being maintained on oral corticosteroids (prednisone >10 mg/day or equivalent).
14. With absolute lymphocyte count <80% of baseline prior to living donor kidney transplantation.
15. Positive for BKV, CMV, or EBV by PCR at screening.
16. Having a body mass index (BMI) < 18 or > 35 kg/m^2.
17. Having contraindication to TBI according to local radiologist.
Exclusion Criteria (Donor):
18. Biologically unrelated female donor transplant to male recipient.
